snippet: Residents of Okushiri, which was devastated in 1993, say that the island’s $1 billion government reconstruction may have helped kill its revival.
abstract: Okushiri Journal; residents of Okushiri, remote Japanese island that was devastated by 1993 earthquake and tsunami, say island’s $1 billion government reconstruction may have helped kill its revival; rebuilding did bring many well-paying construction jobs but many young people, having grown accustomed to higher salaries, refused to return to the hard life of earning livelihood from the sea, and left the island in search of salaried work elsewhere.
lead_paragraph: Residents of Okushiri, which was devastated in 1993, say that the island’s $1 billion government reconstruction may have helped kill its revival.

headline.seo: In Japan, Okushiri, Rebuilt After Quake, Is Cautionary Tale
headline.main: In Japan, a Rebuilt Island Serves as a Cautionary Tale
headline.print_headline: A Rebuilt Island Serves As a Cautionary Tale
